New Records: LeBron James recorded his second straight triple-double, with 19 points, 16 assists, and 10 rebounds, marking the 115th triple-double of his career and the third this season.
Key Match Events: After trailing by double digits early, the Lakers finished the third quarter on a 16-5 run after Anthony Davis' injury, taking the lead for good with Dalton Knecht's 3-pointer.
Post-Match Reflections: The Lakers improved to 5-0 at home and have a winning record through 10 games for the first time in four seasons, despite Anthony Davis' injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chris Boucher and RJ Barrett scored 18 points each for the Raptors, who have lost four straight and eight of nine.
Others: The game was Bronny James' final 1:40 of play.
